snippet: A running mate might ideally help in getting the ticket elected, but more important is the ability to govern.
abstract: Campaign Stops column by Justin S Vaughn examines, as Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump decide who will be number two on their tickets, question of what qualifications make viable vice presidential choice; relates results of survey of members of American Political Science Assn about country's past vice presidents.
lead_paragraph: A running mate might ideally help in getting the ticket elected, but more important is the ability to govern.

headline.print_headline: What Makes a Great Vice President
headline.main: How to Be a Great Vice President
